direction.raw_text: rips the HOLLYWOOD PICTURES LOGO away, and we find ourselves in the middle of...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - NIGHT                                       1 SUPERIMPOSED: SOUTH CHINA SEA The dark blue waters roil and boil and foam. THUNDER CRACKS.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: An enormous Japanese BATHYSCAPHE free-falls through the water. An autonomous fifteen-man submersible. Almost futuristic in its design. The nose cone is an amazing ultra high-pressure plexi-dome. LETTERING along the side tells us this is the "SHINKAI 90000." COMPUTER PRINTED across the SCREEN are the WORDS:
direction.name: direction

result.heading: ABOUT TO BREAK THE WORLD'S RECORD FOR THE DEEPEST DIVE

direction.raw_text: - NIGHT                                     3 The JAPANESE CAPTAIN watches a DLD laser tracking system and barks one-word questions to his JAPANESE CREW. The Sailors work the consoles and give clipped monosyllabic answers. The
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: go over charts on the electronic position board, a contiuously-shifting graphic representation of the ocean contours below. Behind them is an elaborate
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: with computerized graphics. READ: 34,000 feet and dropping. The Crew works at a fevered pitch. An ALARM SOUNDS as the depth gauge sounds 35,000 feet. All eyes on the depth gauge. Several Science Officers share excited looks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : 35,100 -- 35,200 -- 35,300 -- 35,400...4 The excitement builds. Even the Captain's weathered eyes widen. And then, as the depth gauge hits 35,801 feet below sea level, the entire Crew breaks into CHEERS, WHOOPS, HANDSHAKES AND HIGH-FIVES.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - NIGHT                                     5 As it continues its descent, it passes corroding metal drums leaking toxic waste, radioactive waste, dumped in the depths, away from prying eyes, and populated areas. The vessel drops into the SULU BASIN. Imagine the Grand Canyon under forty thousand feet of water. But the Sulu Basin is ten times the size of the Grand Canyon. Down here, ten thousand fathoms below the storm, all is calm. The dual TURBO-PROPS on the ear of the submersible KICK ON. The Bathysaphe is now mobile. It glides down the side of an enormous rock face, carefully avoiding massive sandstone pinnacles which jut up from the ocean floor far below.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - NIGHT                                         6 THE SHINKAI hovers near a gigantic tectonic plate. A ROBOTIC ARM extends out from under the plexi-dome. Its "hand" is a high-tech LASER CUTTER. It approaches the plate, steadies, then fires a direct BLUE BEAM at the bedrock, burns the rock into magma and cuts a perfect round pattern. Another ROBOTIC ARM reaches forward, its CLAW rips out the cut rock from inside the pattern, then takes the sample and sets it inside a hydro-basket on the submersible's port side.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - NIGHT                                    7 A desolate, barren, spooky place. Nothing breathes. Nothing lives. Or so it would appear. The creepy, foreboding MUSICAL SCORE tells us otherwise. The Shinkai ENTERS a huge ROCK FISSURE.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - NIGHT                                     8 The Captain and the Science Officers stare through the plexi dome and out into the freezing, cobalt blue of the PALAWAN TROUGH. The MUSIC intensifies as they round each curve. Then, dead ahead, is the end of the trough, which is half-blocked by a rock-encrusted embankment. The MUSIC builds. The Shinkai approaches the embankment. Slowly starts to glide up the side. The Captain and Science Officers seem mesmerized by all the lonely creepiness. They crest the embankment. And the plexi-domed VIEW FILLS with an unimaginable horror. As far as the eye can see, the entire murky landscape is filled with WHALE BONES. A valley of death. Cluttered here and there, carelessly flung about, are the rusting hulks of several ships. Seemingly ripped apart. Clusters of shark cartilage float through the water like white ghosts. The Captain, the Science Officers and the entire Crew just stare, frozen in place by the strange horror before them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - NIGHT                                     9 The vessel cruises through the valley of death. Everyone is nervously taking readings, making calculations and adjusting equipment. Gone is the excitement and euphoria of the record breaking. Several Crewmen cast nervous glances out through the plexi dome. Giant skeletons everywhere.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - NIGHT                                    10 The Shinkai approaches an eerie-looking rock formation. The robotic arm comes out. The laser cutter steadies, aims, then shoots out its blue beam and cuts into the rock.
direction.name: direction

result.heading: A HUGE JET STREAM OF INKY BLOOD BLASTS OUT OF THE FORMATION

direction.raw_text: !! A HUGE JET STREAM OF INKY BLOOD BLASTS OUT OF THE FORMATION!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - NIGHT                                     11 The Captain and the Science Officers recoil as the inky stuff envelopes the plexi-dome, completely blotting out the VIEW.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - NIGHT                                  12 The Shinkai VANISHES into a huge cloud of inky blood. We HOLD for a LONG OMINOUS BEAT. And then, like a slow-motion earthquake, large boulders and giant crevices begin to shift in the murky waters. WHALE BONES TOPPLE and SCATTER. Several feet under the ancient silt, something is coming alive.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - NIGHT                                    13 Everything outside the plexi-dome is still BLACK. Everyone is staring at the position board, which shows a large section of the OCEAN FLOOR STARTING TO MOVE, its contours incongruous with the rest of the graphic representation. The Science Officers look stunned. The Captain barks commands. The Crew leaps into high gear. Then the Captain reverses the trottle, and petal-to-the-metal he starts to back out. The inky blood swirls past the plexi-dome. Then suddenly, and impossibly, the SUBMERSIBLE JERKS TO A HALT. Everybody goes ass-over-teacups. EQUIPMENT SHATTERS. SPARKS FLY. GLASS BREAKS. Lots of YELLING in Japanese. The SHINKAI starts to ROCK and SHAKE. Something has a hold on it. More EQUIPMENT SHATTERS. Men are thrown about. Then it stops rocking. The Sailors stop yelling. Everything goes dead quiet. Frightened eyes share terror-filled looks. A SOUND is
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: coming from the exterior of the ship, like feet runing across the outside of the hull. Very creepy. The HULL starts to MOAN and CREAK from an UNSEEN PRESSURE. And then the sub begins to be crushed like it's a beer can. The metal HULL TORQUES on all sides. RIVETS POP and SNAP.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: and SHOOTS. More SPARKS FLY. The STEEL PLATING DIMPLES, CRUMBLES and SCREAMS in agony. CHAOS. PANDEMONIUM. And then the SHINKAI IMPLODES. A massive CHURNING SWIRL of water, metal and men.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - SUNSET                                14 THE SAIPAN, a tricked out Jet Foil, built for speed not looks, gunmetal blue, lean and mean, rips across the choppy water. The Rolling Stones STREETFIGHTING MAN pours out of the jet foil, reverberating over the waves, as the CAMERA rushes right at the windsheild and into...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - SUNSET                                    15 Stripped down, low frills, high tech... ...where JOHN T.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: bathed in the last light of day, all taut muscle and sinew, all business, with every one of his 38 years etched on his rugged, good looking face, is harnessed into the steering pylon, wrestling with his steering-sticks, holding the bouncing jetfoil steady as he can, hauling ass, propelled, it seems, by the music blasting out of four state of the art speakers bolted to the metal walls. Light from the laser imagers plays across Finnegan's face. The face of a man in his element, on the edge, in control. He barks commands into his RADIO HEADSET.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: we see LEILA, a muscular Filipina clambering over the foredeck. She's dripping wet. Tough as nails. She turns to Finnegan and "mouths" something into her headset. Finnegan flashes her his most charming smile.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: His HEADSET comes alive withe the SOUND of LEILA bitching in an unintelligible foreign tongue.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He watches as Leila fights the WIND and SEASPRAY and dogs tight a series of hatch-latches across the foredeck.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Leila turns and gives him a "jerking-off" sign with her hand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Radar Imager suddenly blinks, and goes to black. Dead. Finnegan taps on the screen. Nothing. Taps on the console. Still nothing. Simultaneously two more imagers shut down. His mouth screws tight.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Yes, I'm very warm and dry in here, thank you for your concern.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: A raise? I already pay you two bucks a day.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: - NIGHT                                     16 Crammed wall to wall with enough horsepower to fly a 747. Pumped out of two thumping engines. The domain of a scruffy, shifty-eyed, likeable little weasel of a mechanical genius...JOEY PANTUCCI. Wearing a mechanic's toolbelt, slung sideways across the hips like a gunslinger, singing the theme to "Gilligan's Island" over the engine's roar. Way off-key. His hands crammed deep in a tangle of wires. On the walls are a few pictures: Of a few major league engines. Of a few major league pinups, and a few of Pantucci and Finnegan...together in the U.S. Navy...in front of the Saipan in shinier days.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He tugs at the wires.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Finnegan's voice explodes through his headset...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Unperturbed, Pantucci works at the wires.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Pantucci pulls two wires from the tangle.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He begins to strip the wires with his teeth.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: if not for the courage of the fearless crew -- "
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: the Minnow would be lost, the Minowwww would be lost."
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: TUCCI (into radio) Can we use our indoor voice please...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) (radio filtered) I'm flying blind here God damn it!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: TUCCI You trying to make me feel guilty?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: - SUNSET                                    17 Finnegan peers out of the windscreen, trying to see ahead of himself.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Guilty will be the least of what you feel when I run my rig into one of these god damn no name islands! Get me well here!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Pantucci twists one wire around another.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - SUNSET                                    19 The console lights up. The screens come back on line. Finnegan is pleased.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Pantucci works his wrench around an engine mount. And his nervous eyes around six men, big, bad men, standing on the far side of the engines out in a narrow passage. A Maori(VIVO). Two Aussies(MASON and MULLIGAN). A Samoan(MAMOOLI). A Chinese(CHIN). And an Aborigine (BILLY). Tattooed, armed to the teeth, packed in Kevlar body armor. Mercenaries. Who would as soon wring your neck as shake your hand. And a sixth man. HANOVER. The obvious leader. Smoother than the rest, but still showing the edge of a man risen from their ranks. He consults his watch with a growing concern.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - SUNSET                                    21 Finnegan hits a button on his console. The Stones are replaced by the first chords of LAYLA.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: If I told you once...I told you a thousand times...
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: TUCCI (rote) I know...I know...if the cash is there we don't care... (nervous) Finnegan this is as mean a pile of shit as we ever carried... Pantucci notices Hanover impatiently looking at his watch again, and nods for a mass of Aussie mean and muscle named
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: to follow him up a ladder.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He quickly pulls out a wrench, slaps it over a bolt and tightens it down. The leak stops. He blows on the WRENCH like it's a six-shooter, then spins it at the speed of light and holsters it into his toolbelt.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: TUCCI (CONT'D) ...and some of it's coming your way.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: - SUNSET                                    23 As Finnegan is watching the sea ahead, swathed in the shrieking Clapton guitar solos, the hatch opens. Hanover enters, followed by Mason, who leaves the hatch door ajar. Finnegan's eyes remain fixed on the sea. His ears on the Clapton. Hanover and Mason hold onto any available rail as the boat slams over the waves.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hanover looks at the Topo Imager. Holding onto the rail to keep his balance as the boat slams over the choppy sea.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Finnegan points to a spot in the middle of the map.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Finnegan points to another spot on the map.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Finnegan looks at Mason...at the open hatchway just behind him...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...and jams the steering sticks full speed ahead. The force of acceleration tumbles Hanover into the console. Mason tumbles out the open hatchway, down the stairs behind him. As he rises, Hanover regards Finnegan for a moment. A smile flits across his face.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Finnegan's hand finds the console. He hits a button. The first strains of Led Zepplin's WHOLE LOTTA LOVE comes roaring out of the speakers.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Finnegan cranks the sound to the max, pulls back on both steer sticks, and holds on, as the force of acceleration hammers him into the pylon.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: You remember the first time we met Finnegan? I think you were just starting out...smuggling gold off Sumatra for those two Chinese...what did we use to call them?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Fok Yu and Fok Yu Two...are we strolling down memory lane for any particular reason?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No, it just struck me as odd...I don't see you for all these years and you've still got the same tape stuck in the box.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You know what they say...the classics are eternal.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: And where is our point of arrival?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Right here...middle of nowhere...and the answer to your question is yes.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: The one you came up to ask...are we on schedule?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (to Mason) Take note Mr. Mason...this is why you hire a professional...No whining. No excuses.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (attitude) I've heard a lot of stories about you mate...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: All of them flattering I'm sure.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: They were...but they musta been talking about another Finnegan... because the one I heard about was as rough as they came...the one I'm looking at is, well, about as current as the music.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Don't mind him Finnegan...you remember 25...balls of steel... splashing around in a sea of testosterone.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I don't mind him...but I do think it's time for him to get back down below with the rest of the playgroup.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: That's why we're sill around Finnegan...you and me... Nothing gets the feathers up. Business is business. Eh?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: - SUNSET                                       24 The Saipan roars off into the setting sun, hell bent for leather. Zepplin screaming in its wake.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - NIGHT                                 25 Sailing through the mild waters of the South China Sea, a luxury cruise liner. The FUJI MARU. Top of the line. State of the art. And absolutely MASSIVE. No expense has been spared. Breathtaking. Gunfire shatters the serenity of the night.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - NIGHT                                  26 A group of tony British passengers is shooting skeet. Being night, the CLAY PIGEONS are glow-in-the-dark. They EXPLODE over the WATERSPORTS PLATFORM, where TWO JET SKIS swing from harnesses, and TWO SPEEDBOATS are being hoisted up the side.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - NIGHT                               27 Rigged for a formal party. Chinese lanterns sway in the breeze. A band plays. Hundreds of wealthy Passengers, the men in tuxedos, the women in drop dead gowns, dripping with jewelry, dance, flirt, gossip, as an endless stream of waiters ply the floor with champagne laden trays.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ON: The sexiest pair of spiked heels ever to grace the foot of a woman, stopping at the top of the deck. PAN UP: A shimmering golden gown, high slit on the sides to reveal a perfect set of legs, a runway model's body, a cover girl's face...and a thief's sharp ferret eyes. TRILLIAN. A class act from top to bottom. A head turner for either sex, and knows it. She holds an orchid in her hand. Trillian scans the crowd, looking for her prey...and finds him. Her POV. The Ship's smug Captain. JEAN BAPTISTE DELCROIX. She fixes the orchid in her hair just so, about to move...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Trillian looks down to a petite old woman, dressed impeccably, delicate, frail, her beauty long faded except from her eyes. Kindness becomes her, like moonlight does the night.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Old Woman looks at the orchid. And then at Trillian.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Trillian takes the orchid from her hair, and places it in the lapel of the woman's jacket.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The smile Trillian bestows on the old woman is loving, sincere. The moment between them is broken by the keen clear sound of a silver spoon tapping a crystal champagne flute.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: He said an orchid and a beautiful woman belonged together... It was our first date.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: He said that it was the orchid I wore that made him fall in love with me...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: He sounds like a real gentleman.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: The best of the best he was... This cruise was supposed to be our 60th anniversary gift to each other. He died last Spring...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I was going to wear one...special for him...like a memory...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: But without him here I don't know why I should.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Because an orchid and a beautiful woman belong together.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: ON: The deck where the band stops playing. Voices hush. Everyone turns to NIGEL CANTON, 65, tall, elegant, every white hair perfectly in place, impeccably turned out, with the energy, and enthusiasm of a man half his age. Canton stands at the head of the pool, in front of a wall sized aquarium, flanked by his Captain.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The crowd roars with laughter.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Canton lifts his glass.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The crowd swells around Canton. ANGLE ON: The Captain chatting up some passengers when a woman's voice, seductive, beguiling, turns his head to...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Captain's libido rises as he gazes into Trillian's come hither eyes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Trillian takes one step closer, until her moist lips are pursed inches from the captain's.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: His breath catches.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Trillian draws even closer. If looks could cause a man to climax.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Driven to distraction, The Captain turns his attention for a moment to a passenger introducing his wife.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: All my life I had the dream of building the greatest pleasure ship ever to sail the seven seas... tonight, seeing all of you here...so elegant...so beautiful...so rich...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I realize my dream has come true...I thank you all from the bottom of my heart for making it so...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: To the Fuji Maru! Good times forever!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (French) Is it true what they say about a captain and his boat.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (French) Madamoiselle...that the bigger the boat...the bigger the man...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It is a theory I would be glad to put to the test.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (French) In school, the Sisters said testing was my specialty.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: ON: Trillian, turning from the captain into the crowd. C.U. on her hand by the side of her dress. A man's wallet held surreptitiously. Her fingers open the wallet, extract a thin gold card with a black stripe. She discards the wallet, keeps the card, and disappears into the crowd.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - NIGHT                                28 Top of the line. State of the art. The crew is multinational. English is the common language, but everyone has an accent. Canton, the picture of self-satisfaction, enters, sipping champagne.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Captain stands next to a bank of LASER IMAGING SYSTEMS. Canton steps up. Looks down at the THERMAL RADAR IMAGER. Multi-colored LASER IMAGES.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: You wanted to see me Captain?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: We have a storm rising behind us... we may have to close the canopy, I hope it doesn't ruin your party.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (self-satisfied) Ruin my party? Captain, this ship was built to withstand a typhoon. I can't imagine there's anything on the sea today that could possibly ruin my party.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: - NIGHT                                         29 C.U. A crowbar quietly pops the top off a wooden crate to reveal the lethal looking tip of a torpedo...PULL BACK TO: Pantucci in the storage hold, surrounded by half a dozen crates, his wily eyes popped wide with apprehension. He licks his lips nervously, looks around and whispers into his headset.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A hand falls on his shoulder, spinning him around to a fist coming right into his face.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - NIGHT                                     30 Jimi Hendrix. THE STAR SPANGLED BANNER. Blasting. As the Jet foil rockets across the waves. Leila, stripped out of her soaking wet clothes, down to her panties and bra, stands wiping her dripping wet, magnificently ripped body, with a dry towel. Leila puts her fingers in her ears.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And then over the headset, over the Hendrix...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Followed by the unmistakable sound of fist hitting flesh. Finnegan and Leila trade a look.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - NIGHT                                            31 A massive fist plows into Pantucci's stomach. He drops from the arms of MULLIGAN, a scar-faced Irishman with a buzz cut. As quickly as he is doubled over he is yanked up straight by the man who hit him, VIVO, a merciless Maori, covered by tattoos, topped off with venom.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hanover watches calmly as BILLY, the Aborigine, cracks his fist against the side of Pantucci's head, knocking him out of Vivo's arms.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: You know what my goal is? Before I die I want to make love to a woman from every country on earth.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You mean countries that are acknowledged by the UN...or like made up countries too?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What the hell does that mean?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What you talkin'? Samoa's a county!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It's a dot on a map...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Map...no map...I don't give a shit ...they got women on Samoa, it's on the list.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Mr. Billy you're in the batter's box.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: At home we denosy the nosy.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: hoists Pantucci. He draws his knife under Pantucci's bloody nose.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Chinese merc steps forward, and whaps Pantucci upside the head with a cruelly accurate crescent kick. Pantucci hits the wall hard, crumbling. Chin lifts him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Massive Mason steps forward.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mason raises his ham of a fist drawing his tree trunk arm back, taking dead aim at Pantucci's face. He never gets the punch off. His arm is caught from behind. He looks over his shoulder to Finnegan. Gripping his wrist. Right in his face.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mason, enraged, swings with his free hand. Finnegan twists his arm sharply, sending Mason's head into the steel wall, knocking the big man senseless. The other mercenaries go to draw their weapons. Before the guns are out of holsters, Finnegan swings a spear gun into Hanover's face, an inch from his eye.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Finnegan cocks the spear. CLICK! Hanover does not blink. Everyone freezes. With his free hand Finnegan lifts Pantucci to his unsteady feet, the spear stays poised. Finnegan backs out of the room.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: With that Finnegan leads Pantucci out of the hold, slamming the door behind him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Finnegan turns his gaze to Pantucci. It makes the smaller man quiver.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Finnegan stalks off. Pantucci swallows hard, knowing he means it.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: We're not savage here Mr. Billy... we're professionals. Hold him...Mr. Chin...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'll take a go and the I vote we throw the little weasel overboard...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I vote we slit his throat THEN throw him overboard...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: ...this is not a democracy. You don't get a vote.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'll say it again for the hearing impaired...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: This isn't right Finnegan. I've got a contract.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: 20 hours on the clock. Out and back. Double for overtime.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: He did...with a crowbar...you know the rules on a broken contract.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I know it...but you want to get where you want to get, and back? I need a chief engineer, and unless you got a replacement, I'd highly recommend overlooking the indiscretion.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You put me in that position again I'll throw you overboard myself.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: - NIGHT                                       32 A man strides down the hall of an executive passageway, his face obscured in shadows. He has a CANISTER in his hands. Walks through a door MARKED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - NIGHT                   33 The brain center for the whole ship. Rows of computer mainframes, laser-guided imagers and D.T. processors. No humans needed. And none are present. Except one -- The Man strides purposefully down a row of computers, makes a left, then a right. He knows exactly where he's going. He arrives at an ultra-high-tech CONSOLE. The cerebellum. Three similar canisters are plugged into the console. The Man unscrews the middle canister. Screws his canister into its place. Sets the TIMER to 0:300 hours. Pushes a button. The
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: starts to COUNT DOWN.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - NIGHT                                   34 All LIT UP and looking beautiful. The wind is stronger. The party is wilder. The BAND louder. The people drunker. Rain begins to fall. Everybody moans and heads for cover. The deck's huge hydralic canopy begins to close, reviving the party spirit.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - NIGHT                                      35 A gold card with a black stripe slides into the security lock of a high tech vault. Lights blink. Tumblers roll. One after another the electronic locks unlock. Trillian stands back as the massive vault door swings open. With a quick look over her shoulder, she enters the vault.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - NIGHT                                           36 Trillian consults a list, looking for one very specific vault box. Finding it, she pulls a lock pick from her fabulous coiffure, and picks the lock in nothing flat. A pro. Flipping open the box, Trillian removes the only thing she came for. A dazzling diamond ring with the center stone the size of an egg. With a twist, she pops the stone from the setting, holds it up to admire it in the light...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Trillian grits her teeth, and turns to...Canton, the Captain, and two burly Chinese security men.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Canton exits. The Captain steps forward, and removes the diamond ring from Trillian's hand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He slaps her across the face. Trillian flushes, touches the drop of blood at her lip...and decks the Captain with a vicious right cross.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: ...what were you planning on doing with it?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Well you can still proceed with your plans then...in prison...Captain... escort the lady...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: And you...Monsieur...you are not a gentleman.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: - NIGHT                                37 A hatch door bursts open. Trillian is thrown inside. The DOOR SLAMS SHUT. Trillian looks around. No windows. One door. Lots of fruit and vegetables. Trillian accepts the hopelessness of her situation. She takes an apple, sits down and bites deeply, running her options.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - SAME TIME               38 The CANISTER TIMER finishes counting down -- 4 -- 3 -- 2 -- 1. It suddenly EMITS a high-energy HUM. Intense electro static, which builds into...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - NIGHT                              39 ...A screeching guitar solo... The Allman Brothers Band pulses out of the speakers. Finnegan is prepping the wound over Pantucci's eye for sutures. As he swabs it carefully, Leila is at the helm keeping the speeding, bouncing, boat on course.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He carefully threads the surgical needle.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: TUCCI Here's what I think...I think these mokes below are a hit squad.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I saw these guy perform...at Altmont ...you know that? They opened for the Stones...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: TUCCI Right now...there's some bozo sitting on his yacht at those coordinates they gave us, sipping his scotch and soda...totally unawares that we are about to deliver 500 kgs of high power torpedo to light up his ass...that's what's down there in that hold and who knows what the hell else...
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: - NIGHT                                            40 The top of another wooden crate is popped revealing the answer to Pantucci's question: a chilling display of firepower. Pulse rifles. Hand held gatling guns with laser sightings. Oblong grenades. The latest in death delivery systems. Hanover and his men lift and load. Slamming shells into chambers. KA- CHANG! KA-CHANG! KA-CHANG! These boys know their toys.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - NIGHT                                     41 FINNEGAN Hold still now...I was like three rows back. Finnegan centers the needle over Pantucci's wound.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Finnegan sinks the needle into the wound. Pantucci's SCREAM rises above the music.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: TUCCI You don't give a shit about anything do you?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Sure I do...I give a shit that at
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: hour we reach our point of destination. I give a shit that those mojos got to do what they got to do, and 45 minutes later we are turn around and gone. I give a shit that by the time the sun comes up we are all safely tucked in bed.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: TUCCI That's it? That's all you give a shit about?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Oh yeah...and that my stitch job doesn't make you uglier than you already are...this won't hurt a bit...
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: - NIGHT                                       42 The Fuji Maru cruises through RAIN-LASHED waters. Accompanied by a very scary MUSICAL SCORE. Then suddenly, in the extreme foreground, AIR BUBBLES angrily GURGLE to the surface. Then a
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: as if THRASHED from below. Then another WAVE EXPLODES, forty feet to the right. Then
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: eighty feet to the left. And then ALMOST SEEN: Huge, black, ominous THINGS seem to be SQUIRMING beneath the water. Heading for the Fuji Maru.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - NIGHT                                43 RAIN PELTS the canopy. LIGHTNING FLASHES. THUNDER RUMBLES. We can HEAR the PARTY inside. MUSIC, laughs and cheers.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - NIGHT                                      44 The entire ROOM seems to be FRITZING OUT. The lights crackle on and off. The Captain stands behind the bank of failing
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: growing edgier by the moment.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The COM. OFFICER is busy fiddling with the communications and imaging gear. DISTORTED LIGHTS from the scrambled systems plays off their faces.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Captain is confounded, on the edge of panic. Canton hurries onto the bridge.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Canton storms out. Every piece of electrical equipment on the bridge starts to shut down.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: The entire bridge electrical system is shutting down sir!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Switch over to auxiliary power, and run a circuit check.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: . OFFICER We're losing radar and sonar!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What the hell is going on?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Communication systems have failed! Radar...sonar...radios...I don't understand it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: We have a main frame meltdown!!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: - NIGHT                                            45 Where the waves meet the hull, A BALLAST HOLE excretes water. Suddenly, near the ballast hole, a WAVE EXPLODES, thrashed from below. Accompanied by the scary foreboding MUSIC again.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - NIGHT                               46 Trillian, making the best of a bad situation, is just putting the finishing touches on a wonderful salad culled from the stores. As she sits down, spreading a makeshift napkin on her lap just so, a violent SUCKING SOUND comes from above her. Trillian's eyes shoot upward. A VICIOUS GURGLING SOUND RACES through a large PIPE along the ceiling. Trillian leaps to her feet. Backs away. A little spooked.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - NIGHT                              47 An elegant woman sits on the toilet, her gown hiked up inelegantly, reading "Vogue." As she turns the page the same strange sound, a violent sucking, comes from inside the walls, startling her. She looks around the room. Can't see anything. Shrugs it off. Goes back to her magazine. Turns another page.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . And then suddenly -- She SHUDDERS VIOLENTLY and gives a sharp
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Her eyes filled panic. She tries to stand, but she's
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ! Her ARMS FLAIL WILDLY. Scattering stuff off the counter. She tries to SCREAM, but it comes out more like a GURGLE. Below her, in the TOILET, there is a hideous SLURPING SOUND. She manages a final, desperate scream, a high-pitched WAIL. Which nobody hears because...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - NIGHT                                       48 ...the Band has kicked into another ROCK SONG. The drunken revelers whoop and holler, dancing with reckless abandon ignoring the THUNDER and LIGHTNING. And then...with a loud
direction.name: direction

result.heading: CRUISE LINER JERKS TO A STOP

direction.raw_text: the CRUISE LINER JERKS TO A STOP.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: goes CRASH. PEOPLE TUMBLE. TABLES TOPPLE. The
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: as the entire Band falls into the pool.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - NIGHT                               49 Trillian goes ass-over-teacups, rolling over just in time to see a wall of BOXES CRASHING straight down on her. SMASH! She's knocked out cold.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - NIGHT                             50 One of the SPEEDBOATS breaks free of its harness. TOPPLES over the side and drops down into the sea. SPLASH!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - NIGHT                                       51 Everything goes quiet. Everybody freezes. Panic is a heartbeat away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: lights up the top of the canopy. The passengers begin to mutter fearfully. From his perch, Canton fights down his own panic, and addresses the crowd in calm reassuring tones.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The disquieted crowd turns to Canton.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Suddenly, and quite violently, a WOMAN is SUCKED UNDER THE WATER -- THWUP! Others swimmers notice and freeze. The Woman doesn't come back up. And then, THREE more SWIMMERS are violently JERKED UNDER. All the people in and around the pool see this and panic. SCREAMING. YELLING. SWIMMING. SWIMMING and RUNNING. A CRACK OF THUNDER! The Captain calls out -- CAPTAIN Remain calm! Stop! Do you hear?
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Ladies and gentlemen...your attention please... Ladies and gentlemen...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: This is the most technologically advanced sailing vessel on the water today. Every problem has been anticipated...the Captain has assured me that we will be up and running in no time...so enjoy yourselves...there's nothing to worry about...
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: ! The pool clears. Everybody backs the hell away from it. The WATER in the pool BUBBLES, and GURGLES, and then goes quiet. And then, from somewhere deep within the bowels of the ship, comes a loud, eerie, primordial YOWL. WE PUSH IN ON CANTON: His eyes slowly widen. Stunned. His calm replaced by pure terror.
direction.name: direction

result.heading: WE HOLD FOR A LONG, SILENT, EERIE BEAT

direction.raw_text: - NIGHT                                 52 Off in the distance is the cruiseliner. WE HOLD FOR A LONG, SILENT, EERIE BEAT. And then the SCREAMING begins...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - NIGHT                                          53 Blasting through increasingly stormy seas.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - NIGHT                                     54 Finnegan notices Billy, Mulligan and Vivo setting two catapult like devices on the front of the deck.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Leila exits. Finnegan's eyes go up from the action on deck to the radar screen, where a blip, fast moving, right toward the jet foil catches his attention.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Leila see what they're up to...
dialogue.name: dialogue

result.heading: NIGHT 55 A FLASH OF LIGHTNING REVEALS --

direction.raw_text: - NIGHT                                          55 A FLASH OF LIGHTNING REVEALS -- The speedboat from the Fuji Maru hurtling at the hull! BAAROOOOM!!! The speedboat slams into the Saipan. Instant FIREBALL. ANGLE ON: The mercs and Leila slammed to the deck.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - NIGHT                                            56 A GASH is RIPPED out of the bow. METAL FLIES. WATER SPRAYS. The new HOLE VOMITS FLAME. Spewing it over the crates. Hanover and the rest of his men are blown against the walls.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - NIGHT                                     57 Pantucci DIVES as flying SHRAPNEL PEPPERS the two engines. Instantly kills one engine. Maims the other. A FIRE starts.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - NIGHT                                     58 RED WARNING LIGHTS flash and blink. Lighting up the console. The left steering stick dies in Finnegan's hand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - NIGHT                                     59 Mayhem... Fire spews out of the engines. Pantucci sprays a fire extinguisher frantically. Where the shrapnel entered the hull water now spurts with every wave. Smoke and water, oil and fire.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: TUCCI Jezebel's dead...Hercules is right behind her! We got a gusher in the hull!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: - NIGHT                                     60 As the Saipan comes to a halt, Finnegan loses play in his remaining stick.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Finnegan locks the sticks down, and runs out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - NIGHT                                            61 TRACK WITH Finnegan running through the smoke filled hold, past Hanover and the merc's who are pulling themselves off the floor, right into the...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Where Pantucci is beside himself in smoke and sputtering flame.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Finnegan notices something on the floor. He picks up a shard of the speedboat propeller. Strange. Hanover steps into the room.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Finnegan looks at the piece of speedboat in his hand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He shows the piece of speed boat to Hanover. Who stares at it. Finnegan sees the hint of recognition in his eyes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mason grabs Pantucci by the throat, lifting him off the ground.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Finnegan slams the piece of speed boat into the back of Mason's knees buckling him to the floor. In the blink of an eye there is the barrel of a .45 pressed hard against his head, Hanover at the trigger end.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hanover cracks Finnegan across the face with the barrel of the gun. Finnegan's head spins. He touches the corner of his mouth, and comes away with blood, and a look of murder in his eyes. Hanover slams a round in the chamber.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mulligan comes running in.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: TUCCI What did you do to my kids!!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: TUCCI No! The man in the moon!! Who's driving this thing?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Speedboat in the middle of the ocean...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: How soon can we get up and running?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: We can't...we got one engine dead, and the other limping badly.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: TUCCI I spent two years building these things...screw your schedule!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: We were talking about my schedule...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You're going to have to get a new one.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: One more joke and your comedy career is over. Now fix this.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: TUCCI With what? Look at them...they need gears...cylinder heads...oil pans... we're in the middle of the goddamn ocean...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I think he knows that Joey.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: TUCCI Good! So maybe he also know where the hell am I going to get the parts I need...
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: - NIGHT                                          62 Everybody stands on deck as Hanover scans the darkness through a pair of infrared binoculars.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The merc's scatter below deck. Hanover hands the binoculars to Finnegan.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Finnegan's POV through the binoculars. The Fuji Maru in the distance, lit up, beautiful.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Contact verified! You know the drill gentlemen!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Care to see what dreams are made of Finnegan?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: - NIGHT                                            63 BAM! BAM! Two grappling hooks fly from the barrels of the two catapults bolted to the deck, landing on the deck of the Fuji Maru, which looms above the Saipan. Vivo pulls on the lines until they go taut. Finnegan, Pantucci, and Leila stand by watching as the mercs in full assault gear, communication headsets in place, get ready for action.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mason swivels the big HARPOON GUN on the bow.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He FIRES the HARPOON. It shoots and SLAMS into the rear deck of the Fuji Maru.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Swift, athletic, the mercs leap onto the lines and scramble hand over hand toward the Fuji Maru's deck.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The first mercs reach the Fuji Maru's deck, and toss life lines down to Hanover.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hanover hands one line to Finnegan, one to Pantucci. The third he attaches around his waist.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Finnegan and Pantucci comply.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hanover hand signals to his men above. The lines go taut. Finnegan, Pantucci, and Hanover are hoisted to the deck of the Fuji Maru.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: When I was a little bit of a pissant we lived down the road from where all the big cruise ships used to come into Sydney harbor...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Mum and me we used to sit by our front door and watch them...she used to say "one day you're going to make your fortune in life on one of them..."
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Great woman your mother. Real foresight.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: And she could do a hell of a barbie to boot! Belt up. You'll find all the parts you need up there.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I assume somebody up there has made sure no distress signal can be sent.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'd say that's a pretty good assumption.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: TUCCI (nervous) You know the crew could be armed.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: With what? Martinis and tanning oil?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: - NIGHT                                  64 Deathly silent. Not a soul is about. The mercs are deployed in a close military defense pattern.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Everyone hits a button on their watches.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: 25 minutes...by the numbers. Engine room and machine shop are on the third sub deck...Vivo...Mulligan go with them...keep in touch...move out...
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: - NIGHT                              65 A thick black hose weaves it's way across the flooded floor, sucking water. Leila up to her knees in water, wearing a blast visor, stripped down to her skivvies, wields a welder against the gaping hole in the hull. As the boat dips in the waves water sloshes in. Billy sits on the stairs trying to stay dry. He goes to light a cigarette.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She points the acetalyne tank she works with.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Billy heads for the deck. Leila looks after him in disgust.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She ignites her torch, is about to flick her visor down again when a loud gurgling, a sucking sound, stops her. She cuts the torch. Looks around nervously...and then she spots the suction hose sucking away. She smiles to herself. Flips the visor, fires the torch, and goes back to work.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - NIGHT                       66 An alert Mulligan leads Finnegan and Pantucci around a corner. Vivo brings up the rear.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: TUCCI You'd think they'd set a deck watch...
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: : The deck full of people partying, carousing. The railing is lined with 15 lifeboats suspended in their harnesses. FLASH BACK TO: Mulligan, Finnegan, Pantucci and Vivo staring at a completely deserted deck. The lifeboat harnesses swing in the breeze, eerily empty. Mulligan looks back to Vivo.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And then a strange yowl echoes from somewhere deep in the bowels of the ship. Finnegan and Pantucci trade a look.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And again the yowl. Everyone freezes.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: I thought the plan was we'd evacuate them after we got through.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: TUCCI Maybe it's the wrong ship.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (nervous) You ain't giving the orders here!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: - NIGHT                               67 Hanover, Mason, and Chin set foot on the deserted pool deck.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : The pool deck is jammed with people partying. The band playing. Two kids toss a beach ball back and forth. The ball flies over one boy's head... FLASH BACK TO: The ball falls into the empty pool...Where the band's instruments litter the bottom along a big jagged crack.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Uneasy, Hanover and his men look around at the over turned chairs. The smashed aquarium. Chin bends down and picks up a small squid from the bottom of the smashed aquarium. The squid wraps its tentacles around Chin's hand almost immediately. Chin regards it with curiosity.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...and then the yowl freezes them. C.U. on Hanover's face. His eyes flicker with uncertainty...and a tinge of fear.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Focus on the task Mr. Chin...
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: - NIGHT                              68 DING! FLASH TO: A glass elevator descending through the spectacular atrium, full of elegant well-dressed people laughing, chatting. DING! FLASH BACK TO: Mulligan, Vivo, Pantucci, and Finnegan, standing amidst the shattered glass and broken furniture, whirling to the elevator door opening. Mulligan, nerves ajangle, and Vivo, swing their pulse rifles up hard as the door opens to reveal...and empty elevator! DING! The door closes. The car starts to ascend in the eerie silence. The mercs watch it go with growing uneasiness.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - DAWN                                 69 The door to the bridge is KICKED OPEN. Mason and Chin leap inside. Guns out front. On edge. The overhead lights flicker on and off. The imager screens are all black. The STEERING WHEEL slowly ROCKS. As if an invisible captain is steering a ghost ship. Hanover ENTERS. Eyes shifting. Suspicious, and a bit nervous.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: What the hell is going on?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: - DAWN                        70 Mulligan leads Finnegan, Pantucci, Vivo into the casino. The place looks like a mess. Tables and chairs are upended. Glasses and bottles are shattered everywhere. And there's
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: on the floor. A BELL RINGS LOUDLY and the TROLLEY CAR STARTS TO MOVE!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Everyone jumps, freaked. Mulligan and Vivo spin around and
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Start BLOWING the shit out of the TROLLEY CAR. The
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: sound like nothing we've ever heard. ROLLING THUNDER. Absolutely deafening.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - DAY                                         71 The GUNFIRE ECHOES through the hull. Suddenly, with a loud
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: a sixteen-foot-long LIFEBOAT pops to the surface. Then another LIFE BOAT POPS UP. Then ANOTHER. Then THREE MORE off to the port side. Then TWO MORE off to the starboard. It's as if the SOUND of the GUNFIRE is somehow releasing the boats from their watery graves. They start to drift away. Spooky quiet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - NIGHT                           72 BULLETS RAKE the Trolley's metal sides. The WINDSHIELD EXPLODES. Finnegan yells at Mulligan and Vivo -- FINNEGAN Guys!! Whoa! WHOA! WHOA! WHOOOAAA!! Finnegan finally tilts the muzzle of Mulligan's gun to the ceiling. They stop firing. A little wigged-out. Their professional demeanor going by the boards. All goes quiet. They look at Finnegan, who is the picture of calm.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Trolley car reverses. The ELECTRONIC VOICE is now CRACKED -- ELECTRONIC VOICE Next stop, Fisherman's Wharf. Mulligan whirls, his gun poised. Just then his headset crackles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Finnegan leans in towards Mulligan's mike.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mulligan pulls the radio away.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) (radio filtered) This is Red One...status report.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (into radio) Your boys just killed a trolley car Red One.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (into radio) We been down three decks, there's nobody home... Total spooky-town. Advise on how to proceed.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: - NIGHT                                   73 Hanover looks around at the empty bridge, the blinking lights.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But the look in Hanover's slightly unnerved eyes tells a different story.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Stay to the schedule. Stay to the plan. Nothing has changed.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: - DAY                            74 Trillian goggily crawls out from under a mound of boxes. Her left eye's got a nice purple shiner. Her elegant gown is ripped. A VERY STRANGE SOUND coming from behind the wall. Wet. Gooey. Slithery. Ominous. Trillian freezes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The SOUND slowly MOVES across the wall. Then another WALL starts to GURGLE. Trillian spins around. She forces herself not to panic. Very cautiously, taking small measured steps she reaches the handle to the freezer, and tries to open it. No go. The gurgling ripples above her. Her mouth goes dry as her eyes follow the sound across the ceiling. Her hand goes to her hair. She pulls her lock pick out, and very slowly kneels down until she is eye level with the door lock. She begins to pick her way out, her ears and eyes following the gurgling above. Suddenly the sound stops. The silence makes Trillian's heart sound that much louder. She sidles close to the wall.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Still silence. Cautious, she taps on the wall. For a moment nothing. And then... WHAMM!! Something slams against the wall from the other side in response. Trillian falls back against the door, her heart in her throat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - DAY                                   75 A MAZE of pipes, hoses, gears, engines and catwalks. THINGS are HISSING, HUMMING, RUMBLING and CLANKING. A spooky place. Dark. Damp. Eerie. Ominous. Mulligan and Vivo, looking more nervous by the moment, lead the way. Finnegan and Pantucci follow.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Finnegan turns to Pantucci, his voice even, calm, almost kind.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He forces Pantucci to look him in the eyes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Pantucci draws his strength from Finnegan. He forces himself to take a deep breath.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Suddenly, overhead, something black and veiny skitters across the mass of pipes, so fast it shocks Pantucci back into the wall.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He and Vivo spin their guns at the pipes. The red dots of their laser sights sweep the shadowy web of metal. Nothing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Finnegan turns to Pantucci, who has not moved from where he hit the wall.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Pantucci tries to pull away from the wall. He is stuck.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Finnegan takes Pantucci by the front of his shirt, ignoring Mulligan.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As Finnegan pulls, Pantucci does as he is told. He slips away from the wall. The jacket doesn't.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He reaches out to touch the wall. Finnegan grabs his wrist, grabs a flashlight from Vivo's utility belt and shines it on the wall. Their POV -- the entire wall is covered in a strange, yellow, secreted GELATIN. Laid on in some sort of weird, inhuman, geometric pattern. Like a spider web.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: TUCCI (rattling, nervous) You know what I'm gonna do after this...I'm gonna get a normal life...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: TUCCI ...Like a house in the suburbs... maybe a couple of kids...some sort of business...be in the bowling league...go to the ball games...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: TUCCI What? You don't think I can have a normal life?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: We're gonna get what we gotta get... do what we gotta do...and get the hell outta here...okay?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Come on...the sooner we get outta here the better I'll feel. Mulligan and Vivo move forward.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (jumpy) Hey! What are you trying to pull!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: - DAY                                 76 Leila has welded half the hole shut. A GUSH OF WATER suddenly pours through the other half. Leila cuts the torch.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The KA-CHUNK-KA-CHUNK of the PUMP is like a loud scary
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Leila removes her blast visor. Wipes her brow. -- A MANGLED CORPSE GUSHES IN through the gaping hole! LEILA SCREAMS. Bloody murder. Scared shitless. Quickly backs away. Actually, it's only half a corpse. The bottom half having been eaten away. It's wearing a tuxedo. The corpse's face is tightly constricted, eyes wide open, a grotesque death mask. Leila shakes like a leaf, waist-deep in seawater.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - NIGHT                                     77 Billy is staring out at all the lifeboats as they drift away. All he can hear is the loud KA-CHUNK-KA-CHUNK of the PUMP. He talks into his headset -- BILLY (into radio) I dunno where they came from, turned around and there they were. (pause) No, no passengers. (pause) No shit I'll keep my eyes open.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - NIGHT                                     78 Leila trembles in the waist-high water. The PUMP'S HEARTBEAT seems to have gotten louder. KA-CHUNK-KA-CHUNK-KA-CHUNK. Leila slowly starts edging her way around the corpse. KA-CHUNK-KA-CHUNK-KA-CHUNK-KA-CHUNK. Her eyes are transfixed, staring at the abomination, too scared to scream. KA-CHUNK-KA-CHUNK-KA-CHUNK. Her back is to the gaping hole as she slowly starts to pass in front of it. KA-CHUNK-KA-CHUNK-KA-CHUNK. The water swirls around her waist. KA-CHUNK-KA-CHUNK-KA-CHUNK. She's almost past the gaping hole now. KA-CHUNK-KA-CHUNK-KA-CHUNK... Then something grabs her! She SCREAMS! And falls back towards the gaping hole -- But it's only a twisted piece of metal off a strut. She exhales. Relieved. KA-CHUNK-KA-CHUNK-KA-CHUNK. Suddenly, LEILA'S whole body SPASMS. She SCREECHES wildly, in great pain. The she's RIPPED backward out through the gaping hole. Gone. WATER SLOSHES back in. KA-CHUNK-KA-CHUNK-KA-CHUNK.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - NIGHT                          79 Knee deep in water, an edgy Mulligan watches Finnegan as he disassembles pieces of a thermal carburetor from an auxiliary generator. His eyes keep shifting around. Over in the far corner Vivo is watching Pantucci working over a metal lathe, repairing the cylinder head. Metal-on-metal. Vivo sits up on a barrel, trying to keep his feet out of the water.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Vivo pulls his feet further up on the barrel.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Then out of the corner of his eye, Vivo sees SOMETHING MOVE. He spins around. Nothing but pipes and hoses.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Finnegan and Pantucci stop working. All eyes are focused on the maze of pipes. THINGS are HISSING, HUMMING and RUMBLING. Nothing moves.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Disgusted, Vivo puts his feet in the water, gingerly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He walks toward the mass of hissing pipes. His pulse rifle rising.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Then he hears a strange SLURPING and SUCKING SOUND coming from behind some gears at the end of a little alleyway.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Vivo slowly goes in for a closer look, gun out front, heading down the little alleyway. He looks behind some pipes. The
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: The hulls of these things are supposed to be impregnable...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: So...If the hull's impregnable why are my feet wet?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Why don't you just stop figuring and keep working so we can get the hell out of here?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: TUCCI Why don't you help us so we can get done faster so we can get the hell out of here?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: 'Cause grease monkey ain't in my job description dick head...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What I want to know is why the goddamn ocean is always cold...since I'm a kid I hate god damn cold water.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Hey! You hear me? Come out! Still no response.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Will you check it the hell out!!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'm gonna kick your ass for putting me through this...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'm not screwing around with you man...I hate the cold water.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: gets LOUDER. Then he sees it. His eyes widen -- VIVO (CONT'D) On shit! And that's the last thing he ever says. Because just then, from a dark area between the pipes, SOMETHING SHOOTS OUT! Mulligan, Finnegan, and Pantucci stare in horrified amazement as Vivo is viciously YANKED into the pipes. A moment later a WASH OF BLOOD is FLUNG across a wall. Mulligan freaks out, aims his rifle at the pipes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As Mulligan's attention diverts, Finnegan instinctively heads for Vivo's rifle, lying on the floor. Mulligan swings around.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: !! His rifle is armed. The laser dot fixes on Finnegan's forehead.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Finnegan freezes, looking up at a very freaked out Mulligan.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Everybody's breathing hard. Freaked out. Major tension. Blood drips down the wall.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Touch it and you're dead, asshole!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: TUCCI Don't shoot, man, don't shoot!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What happened to Vivo?! What the hell happened to Vivo?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: - NIGHT                                      80 Trillian steps up to the vault, looking around, a bit nervous, something is definitely not right here.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She shrugs, must be her imagination. From inside her low cut dress she pulls the Captain's gold security card. She is about to run it through the reader slot when... V.O. Ahem... She spins to...Hanover, Mason, Mamooli and Chin. Looking grim.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mason and Chin lift their pulse-rifles. KACHUNK!!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Trillian is confused -- TRILLIAN What do you mean? Hanover steps forward, right in her face.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hanover grabs Trillian by the throat and slams her against the wall. He rams his gun against her forehead.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hanover blinks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Trillian shrugs. Mason grabs the card out of her hand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mason runs the card through the slot. The ELECTRONICS KICK IN. LIGHTS FLASH. TUMBLERS ROLL. CLICK! It unlocks. Hanover's
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (recovering) I'm sorry... This area is for authorized personnel only. As the assistant to the Purser, I'm afraid I'll have to ask you to vacate...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You tell it straight or I pull the trigger. Who are you?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Forget her...let's get what we came for and get the hell out of here!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: comes alive with Mulligan SCREAMING.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Mulligan?? What?? I can't hear you?? Repeat I...
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Mason JERKS the vault door open. A FIRE-AXE SWING DOWN into his head, WHUMP! Kills him instantly. Eyes wide open. Everybody freaks out. Jumps back. Hanover lets go of Trillian, and stares into the vault directly at Nigel Canton. Holding the axe.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Behind Canton the Captain is on the floor, in severe pain, his clothes are ripped up, REVEALING nasty looking RED SCARS, blistered and puffy, all over his chest and arms.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Chin jams his rifle to the middle of Canton's forehead, and cocks a round into the chamber.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But this is one soldier who is slow to obey the order. Hanover grabs Chin by both shoulders and gives a colossal yank.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He slams Chin against the wall. In the process he loses his headset.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Chin and Hanover stare at each other, their chests heaving. Mason finally drops to the ground. All she wrote.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Oh my God. I didn't mean to...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I thought it was one of them!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I didn't mean to! I though it was one of them!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: - NIGHT                                    81 The machinery is sputtering, and sparking, shorting, steaming as the sea rises. Mulligan, in a panic, has backed Finnegan and Pantucci into a corner. He screams over his headset.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No response. A sucking sound comes from the dark mass of pipes. Mulligan spins.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mulligan spins back to Finnegan and Pantucci.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Suddenly, Mulligan's LEGS are suddenly JERKED OUT from under him. He hits the floor hard. Starts FIRING WILDLY. Finnegan and Pantucci hit the watery deck. BULLETS RICOCHET everywhere. Mulligan is WHIPPED across the floor. SCREAMING in fear. His pulse-rifle goes flying. He's
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Hanover!...Hanover! Come in! Come in you son-of-a-bitch!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Shut up, man, just shut the hell up! I gotta think! I gotta think!!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: TUCCI What's there to think about?? That
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: There ain't no thing here!! No thing!! There's you him and me!! Got it! You him and...
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: into a metal pylon, then SUCKED into a dark void in the pipes. All in the blink of an eye. Finnegan grabs Mulligan's pulse-rifle. OPENS FIRE. BLASTING the shit out of anything and everything that moves.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Pantucci grabs the knapsack, cramming as many parts as he can into it as Finnegan keeps firing into the steaming, creaking, sparking machinery.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Pantucci doesn't have to be told twice. He runs like hell, with Finnegan firing a final burst, and following.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - NIGHT                                           82 Everyone hears the MASSIVE GUNFIRE. Hanover looks around for the source of the sound. He finds it in his discarded headset.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The gunfire stops, replaced by an ominous, horrifying, sucking sound.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He runs out of the vault. The Captain follows close behind. Hanover listens to the sucking sound getting louder and louder.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hanover rushes out with Chin right behind. Only Trillian remains, breathing deeply, scared...but not scared enough to forget the reason she came cruising in the first place. She goes right to the vault, opens one of the boxes, removes the giant diamond, drops it down her decolletage, pulls her high heels off, and runs out.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: This is Red one! Come in Red two!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (panicked) It's them! We've got to get off!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: - NIGHT                                     83 Finnegan and Pantucci run to the end of a long section of metal grating, right below a staircase, to catch their breath. Everything has gone dead quiet, except for the billowing and clanging of the engines. Smoke and sparks obscure their vision.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Both of them listen to the silence. And then, at the far end of the grating, one grate rises...and falls. Finnegan and Pantucci watch, transfixed. Then, like a locomotive gathering speed, the grates start rising and falling, faster and faster, clanking louder and louder, headed right for the two of them.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: TUCCI Finnegan, what the hell was that?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I don't know...you got what we need?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: TUCCI If I don't, I ain't going back to get it...you think we're safe?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Finnegan and Pantucci run up the stairs as fast as they can...just as the grate they were standing on rises and falls. Silence returns. Except for the steaming, creaking machinery...and an ominous sucking sound.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - NIGHT                                      84 Trillian comes running down the passageway to a freight elevator. Looking over her shoulder, she hits the button. The elevator doors open to a freight elevator large enough to hold a dozen people. Trillian rushes in and hits the up button. She breathes a sigh of relief as the steel doors close...until the elevator starts going down.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She panics. And starts pushing the up button frantically, her heart pounding in her chest. There is not a sound except for the hum of the elevator descending...until something drops on the roof with a THUMP! Trillian screams. The elevator comes to a bumps stop.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Trillian shrinks from the ceiling of the elevator...and then the car starts to move again.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Trillian pounds on ever button on the console, to no avail. The car continues its inexorable descent. Finally, in desperation, she hits the emergency stop button. The elevator stops. The emergency SIREN WHINES. A LONG BEAT. Nothing moves...and then...
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Up!! I want to go up!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: ! Something beats on the roof, trying to break in. And again -- WHAM! The ELEVATOR SHUDDERS and continues its descent. Trillian backs up against the wall, staring at the ceiling, scared. The ELEVATOR DINGS! Startled, TRILLIAN SCREAMS. The DOORS start to OPEN. Panicked, Trillian raises the only weapon at her disposal...a high heel. The DOORS OPEN. -- SOMETHING LUNGES IN! Trillian swings her high heel...right into Pantucci's face! Finnegan plows in right behind him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Trillian tries to run out. Finnegan grabs her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Trillian struggles. Finnegan does not let go of her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Trillian buries her high heel into the back of Finnegan's hand, breaking his grip.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Just then, the doors to the elevator shut, and the car starts to ascend.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Trillian hears music to her ears.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Her demeanor changes, her voice goes to honey.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Trillian and Finnegan turn to Pantucci who is looking down at the floor where a mass of yellow slime has dripped from the ceiling. All look up to the yellow goo dripping from the ceiling...followed by a sucking sound.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Finnegan lifts his pulse rifle and blasts the ceiling. The sucking sound stops.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The elevator stops. DING! The door opens. Finnegan whirls his rifle, rising. Trillian lifts her high heel, ready to strike... Hanover, Chin, and Mamooli have their massive guns trained on the car. The Captain and Canton quiver behind them. There is a momentary stand off.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Chin charges Finnegan, the butt of his rifle raised to smash Finnegan's skull. Finnegan parries and drives Chin into the rear wall of the elevator. Mamooli jumps Finnegan from behind, wrapping his rifle against Finnegan's throat. Pantucci jumps on Mamooli's massive back, ripping at his face. Finnegan drops, buries his elbow in Mamooli's solar plexus, spins, and has his knife out of his boot and at Mamooli's throat in a flash. ANGLE ON: Trillian. Impressed. She had no idea.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Finnegan looks up into the barrel of Hanover's gun...and a pair of eyes that will use it. Finnegan does as he is told.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Again, Finnegan does as he is told.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Captain and Canton are only to happy to comply. As they slip in, Trillian tries to slip out. Hanover swings his gun on her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hanover hit the elevator button. The elevator starts to rise.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: All of a sudden, the car is jerked to a halt, as if some giant hand was yanking on the cable.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And then, the elevator jerks down again. And up. Everyone is thrown about like straw. Everyone is shouting, panicked. And then the jerking stops...and the sound of sucking surrounds the car. The cable starts twisting, creaking sickeningly above their heads.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Trillian starts hitting the buttons frantically.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Finnegan is at the doors, pulling them with all his might.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Pantucci, then Mamooli, then Hanover and Chin pull at the doors as Trillian keeps hitting the buttons. The doors part a bit.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The doors fly open to...a solid wall.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And silence...until the doors slam shut...the cable snaps...and the car plummets! Screaming and shouting mixes with the bloodcurdling shrieking of the metal elevator frame against the shaft. Finnegan's eyes go to the floor indicator.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: It ain't any better out there!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I saved your life is what I did!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: TUCCI What the hell's going on here?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You're with that other bunch, right?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: TUCCI Man, there's something here! On the boat!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Shut up! Shut up all of you! Now here's what we're doing... Mamooli is going to take you back to fix your engines, Chin and I are staying here to finish the job...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: TUCCI It's gonna snap the cable!
dialogue.name: dialogue
